items.title: Forced adoption redress scheme to offer compensation for impacted Tasmanians
items.summary: More than 13 years after the Tasmanian state government delivered an apology to mothers impacted by the historical practice of forced adoptions, a redress scheme will offer compensation to those impacted.

items.title: Australia's first fluorite mine faces 'deep opposition' from Kimberley traditional owners
items.summary: Traditional owners have raised cultural and environmental concerns about a proposed fluorite mine in Western Australia's remote Kimberley region.

items.title: Waroona weighs up planned gallium refinery funded by US-Australia critical minerals deal
items.summary: Locals in the WA community of Waroona are welcoming a US-Australia deal set to build a new rare earth refinery south of Perth, but others warn the project will further entrench mining interests.

items.title: KAPCO deal with NT abattoir to supply communities with affordable Kimberley beef
items.summary: A cattle company in Western Australia's Kimberley has struck a deal with a Northern Territory abattoir to get local beef to consumers in remote communities.

items.title: Mount Stirling Resort financial deficit prompts review of winter operations

items.title: Parts of NSW and Victoria 'absolutely battered' by howling winds, storm damage in Greater Sydney
items.summary: Howling winds overnight will lead to extensive clean-up work today in NSW's south-east and parts of Victoria, with October heat records also broken in Western Sydney.

items.title: Markets live updates: Netflix shares slump 10pc, Tesla stocks down despite EV rush, ASX to fall

items.title: 'Daughter's promise' inspires Darkinyung dictionary to revive sleepy language

items.title: South Energy plans 100-megawatt battery project for Victoria's Macedon Ranges

items.title: Claims foster care payments have been cut spark concern for kids with complex needs
items.summary: Foster carers in Victoria say sudden allowance reductions for children with complex needs have left them feeling "undervalued and confused".

items.title: Masses of NT prison rehabilitation sessions cancelled as prisoner numbers surge
items.summary: As the Northern Territory prison population continues to reach all-time highs, data reveals a majority of the NT's rehab program are being cancelled more often than they are being delivered.

items.title: Oscar Piastri confident in F1 championship battle against Lando Norris and Max Verstappen in Mexico
items.summary: This year may be the first time in F1 that Oscar Piastri has been under the cosh of a title fight, but it is not the first time he has been in a three-way fight for a championship.

items.title: Why mpox cases in Australia in 2025 are a fraction of what they were last year
items.summary: Mpox transmission surged between July to September last year, but there have been far fewer cases recorded in 2025.

items.title: Amid a small investor rush on precious metals, have the gold and silver bubbles popped?

items.title: 'Localised extinction' risk for seagrass in Botany Bay
items.summary: It is estimated half of the local seagrass habitat in Gamay (Botany Bay) has already been lost. Researchers and Aboriginal rangers are replanting seagrass fragments and using biochar to restore the area.

items.title: Seafood has undeserved reputation as source of microplastic exposure, scientists say
items.summary: There are microplastics in almost everything, so why does seafood get such a bad reputation? Scientists say it is down to disproportionate research and media attention.

items.title: The move to break China's iron grip on world's supply of critical minerals

items.title: State government refuses mandatory catch reporting for recreational fishers amid fish stock crisis

items.title: ACT government introduces bill to restrict same-day alcohol deliveries in Canberra

items.title: Premier proposes laws to protect police and families from harassment
items.summary: People found guilty of harassing or stalking a police officer or members of their family could face up to 10 years in prison under new laws proposed by the state government.

items.title: New board members appointed as Hobart Clinic works towards reopening
